term.title: complementary DNA

item.text: A single-stranded DNA molecule with a nucleotidesequence that is complementary to an RNA molecule; cDNA is formed by the action of the enzyme reverse transcriptase on an RNAtemplate. After conversion to the double-stranded form, cDNA is used for molecular cloning or for hybridization studies.

sources.item: PAC, 1992, 64, 143. 'Glossary for chemists of terms used in biotechnology (IUPAC Recommendations 1992)' on page 150 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199264010143)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
